article_title: Supreme Court to Consider Worker Pay for Security Screenings
article_text:
The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday agreed to decide whether workers should be paid for time spent going through theft-deterrence screenings at the end of their shifts, taking up a case brought by Amazon.com Inc. warehouse employees.

The case, which will be heard in the fall, could affect roughly 600,000 current and former workers at Amazon facilities, according to a lawyer for the plaintiffs. It also could affect other retailers that...
